Description: Pale-red pottery ostracon, from the body of a large convex vessel, interior grooved and exterior covered with a cream-coloured slip, with remains of fourteen lines of black-painted demotic text on the exterior, very faded in places.
Curator's comments: This ostracon yields a so-called r-rḫ=w ("that which was measured") text. These texts, all originating from the Thebaid in the Ptolemaic and early- Roman period, were issued to farmers after a measurement of their cultivated land had been conducted in order to determine due amounts of harvest tax. (Information provided by Gert Baetens, KULeuven) Bibliography: Kaplony-Heckel No.21. Kaplony-Heckel, U., 2001, Theben-Ost III (1) : Die r-rḫ=w Tempel Quittungen und ähnliche Texte, Theben Ost Teil 3,erster Teil, Texte Nr.18-25, ZÄS 128, pp.37. Kaplony-Heckel, U., 2009, Land und Leute am Nil nach demotischen Inschriften, Papyri und Ostraca, Gesammelte Schriften Teil 2, Harrassowitz Verlag; Wiesbaden, pp.921. On the text genre, see: For r-rḫ=w texts, cf. Vandorpe K., 'The Ptolemaic Epigraphe or Harvest tax (shemu)', in Archiv für Papyrusforschung 46 (2000), p. 165-228. Kaplony-Heckel U., Thebanische Acker- Amt-Quittungen, in Allam, S., Grund und Boden in Altägypten (rechtliche und sozio-ökonomische Verhältnisse): Akten des internationalen Symposions Tübingen 18.-20. Juni 1990 (Untersuchungen zum Rechtsleben im alten Ägypten; Band 2) Tübingen, 1994, pp. 189-197.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (81550) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/81550)
